phrase.cizu_name: take some (或 a lot of) beating

entry.tran: （尤指用棍子等进行的）殴打，痛打
entry.def: If someone is given a beating, they are hit hard many times, especially with something such as a stick.

example.ex: ...the savage beating of a black motorist by white police officers...
example.tran: 白人警察对一名黑人驾车者的野蛮殴打。

example.ex: The team secured pictures of prisoners showing signs of severe beatings.
example.tran: 这个小组搞到了一些显示囚犯有被毒打痕迹的照片。

entry.def: If something such as a business, a political party, or a team takes a beating, it is defeated by a large amount in a competition or election.

example.ex: Our firm has taken a terrible beating in recent years.
example.tran: 我们公司近几年败得一塌糊涂。

entry.def: If you say that something will take some beating, you mean that it is very good and it is unlikely that anything better will be done or made.

example.ex: For sheer scale and grandeur, Leeds Castle in Kent takes some beating.
example.tran: 单从规模和气势来说，肯特的利兹城堡独领风骚。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of overcoming or outdoing
2. the act of inflicting corporal punishment with repeated blows
1. expanding and contracting rhythmically as to the beating of the heart;

auth_sentence.content: Despots will take heart from Britain beating the press.
auth_sentence.res_content: Despots will take heart from Britain beating the press.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Despots will take heart from Britain beating the press.

auth_sentence.res_content: Keep beating and add remaining sugar and ground almonds.

auth_sentence.content: I could feel my blood beating in my neck.
auth_sentence.res_content: I could feel my blood beating in my neck.

sentences.en: They caught him and gave him a violent beating.
sentences.cn: 他们抓住了他，把他狠狠打了一顿。

sentences.en: The beating came and went in waves.
sentences.cn: 毒打一阵一阵地时作时辍。

sentences.en: The team took a terrible beating.
A higher school team would have a fat chance beating a strong college team.
sentences.cn: 一个中学队不太可能击败实力强的大学队。

sentences.en: Johnson sprung a surprise by beating the favourite in the first round.
sentences.cn: 约翰逊爆出了冷门儿，在第一回合就打败了夺冠呼声最高的选手。

means.word_mean: 有规律的敲打(声);有节奏的运动(声)

sentences.en: Her heart seemed to stop beating.
sentences.cn: 她的心脏似乎停止跳动了。

sentences.en: The house took a terrible beating during the storms.
sentences.cn: 这房子在暴风雨中受到很大的破坏。

sentences.en: Dad’s good humour had taken a beating.
sentences.cn: 爸爸的好心情被破坏了。

sentences.en: Share prices on the London Stock Exchange took a beating last week.
sentences.cn: 伦敦股票交易所的股价上周受到重创。

sentences.en: As a place to live, Oxford takes some beating.
sentences.cn: 就居住环境而言，牛津是个难得的好地方。
